Title:
A new species of Laccaria occurring in the montane cloud
forest from eastern Mexico
Keywords:
Ectomycorrhizal fungi, ITS, LSU, Neotropical fungi,
Tricholomatales
Abstract:
Abstract: An undescribed species of Laccaria was
discovered in the Santuario Del Bosque de Niebla of Xalapa, Mexico, in a
montane cloud forest preserved under the protection of the Instituto de
EcologÃ­a A.C. (INECOL) in Veracruz State. This new species is distinct
based on basidiome morphology and supported by phylogenetic analyses of
sequences of the nuclear ribosomal DNA ITS and LSU regions. Fourteen
different collections obtained during 2012-2014, provided a wide
morphological variation and diagnostic color changes. Descriptions are
accompanied by color images of the basidiomata, SEM photomicrographs of
basidiospores and comparisons with related taxa.
